text: hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I want to show
you how to make a very simple but
classic buttercream frosting now I'm
doing this because of a couple reasons
one it's been very highly requested and
partly because a while back I did an
episode on how to make it's just a
simple vanilla cupcake with a raspberry
buttercream and on that episode everyone
was asking me how to make a really
simple basic buttercream not a raspberry
buttercream so I figured I'm going to
show you how to do it and also the other
reason I'm making it is because I'm
using this frosting to just decorate
some cupcakes for Halloween so I figured
to show you because buttercream it is
the number one frosting just decorate
about anything with that's why they
decorate wedding cakes with it it's a
very it's it's you can use it very well
it's got a very good consistency it
comes to decorating with it so here we
go the ingredients for them for it's

need some confectioner sugar some
unsalted butter it's really important
it's a room temperature some whole milk
and vanilla extract that's it and now I
know this has a lot of confectioner's
sugar but this is what gives it of
course the sweet to a taste but the
great texture that we can decorate a
cupcake with right so I'm using my handy
dandy little standing mixer here just
cuz it's easy and now in this big bowl
I'm going to add my butter and my
confectioner sugar along with the

I'm using a paddle attachment because I

I'll very low otherwise you're going to

just going to start mixing this until

running we can do it a medium at this
point I'm going to add in some whole
milk about tablespoon at a time just
until you have a

to 4 tablespoons so a little bit less
now I know that with one more tablespoon
I'm probably going to have enough steam
let that mix for another second or two
check it that looks perfect see that

is going to be perfect to decorate my
